title: Saipan
summary: Saipan (/saɪˈpæn/ Chamorro: Sa’ipan, formerly in Spanish: Saipán, and in Japanese: 彩帆島, romanized: Saipan-tō) is the largest island of the Northern Mariana Islands, a commonwealth of the United States in the western Pacific Ocean. According to 2017 estimates by the United States Census Bureau and the Commonwealth's Department of Commerce, Saipan's population was 47,565.[2]
